verses.roman:
saptaite go-vṛṣā vīra
durdāntā duravagrahāḥ
etair bhagnāḥ su-bahavo
bhinna-gātrā nṛpātmajāḥ

synonyms: sapta—seven; ete—these; go-vṛṣāḥ—bulls; vīra—O hero; durdāntāḥ—wild; duravagrahāḥ—unbreakable; etaiḥ—by them; bhagnāḥ—defeated; su-bahavaḥ—very many; bhinna—broken; gātrāḥ—their limbs; nṛpa—of kings; ātma-jāḥ—sons.
translation: These seven wild bulls are impossible to tame, O hero. They have defeated many princes, breaking their limbs.
